author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, we dive into the design behind the Iris replication system, an opt-in replication system that works alongside Unreal Engine's existing replication system. 

You'll learn about the compromises made during design to remain as backward-compatible as possible, and about the most efficient path for migrating your existing serialization, replication graph code, and configuration to Iris. 

Topics covered in the session include a tour of the core components of Iris such as prioritization and filtering, and how to maximize backward compatibility and performance using these systems. 

Learn about the new serialization path using NetSerializers, and their benefits and differences to the existing serialization. The session also includes a look at tools, tips, and tricks for debugging bandwidth to optimize performance and maximize the gameplay experience. You'll also find out about new features coming to Iris in the future.

Learn more about U
title: Developing and Launching a New Replication System | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Cody Albert is bringing his engineering and tool making know-how to Stockholmsmässan in September🛠️

For the last decade, Cody's been helping develop tools and his talk will help you debug your own tools with the SlateIM plugin!: http://epic.gm/unreal-fest-stockholm-agenda
title: Unreal Fest Stockholm Meet the Presenter: Cody

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, Gardens Interactive showcase how Unreal Engine engineers can iterate on their multiplayer game with Gardens’ backend platform Alamode.

This session starts with an introduction to typical multiplayer game architecture and a discussion of what Unreal Engine best practices do and don't cover. Next up are challenges observed at previous studios and how Gardens approached these challenges.

Learn about the issues Alamode solves using technology like Docker and zero-trust VPNs and hear about current use cases.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com
title: Rapid Multiplayer Iteration With a Backend Platform | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025
